intro: Echeandia conzattii, commonly known as the Conzatti's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, displaying small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Echeandia conzattii is also known for its ability to bloom rapidly after rainfall, making it a short-lived but striking desert plant.
